lines.text: ∆ U = change in thermal energy, W = work done by the engine
W = work, P = pressure, ∆ V = change in volume

secText:
Lesson:
1. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_l062:first two processes] of an engine cycle in terms of work, pressure, volume, and temperature.
2. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_l063:last process] of an engine cycle in terms of work, pressure, volume, temperature.
3. Define and calculate [OBJ:expsec_l064:adiabatic processes].
4. Define and calculate [OBJ:expsec_l065:isobaric and constant volume processes].
5. [OBJ:der_work_pressure_volume:Derive] the relationship between work, pressure, and volume.
